Reviews.Title: “Basic, but comfy and nice”
Reviews.Author: HolyDuck
Reviews.Content: Motel One is a chain affair, but with much more design flair than most of the much larger competitors. Nice furniture, good color schemes, etc. It might have helped that this one was spanking new, though. The room was small but well equipped, though if this had been a real business trip - with need for lot of computer work - I might have longed for a real desk chair instead of the footstool type thing. The comfy chair by the window also really wasn't very comfy. The bed was nice, though, with a firm mattress, which I like. Bathroom and shower good, too, but I dislike the (German?) habit of putting the sink and mirror outside the batroom. What the ... is that about? Internet access was not blazing fast, but free in lobby or 5 Euro for 24 hours in room, which isn't too bad. Didn't try breakfast, but had ok coffee in lobby. Really, really missed a boiler and/or coffee in room, but this is one of the places where Motel One is basic and has cut back, apparently.

Reviews.Title: “Tight Quarters, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: ridethestallion
Reviews.Content: Motel One Berlin Mitte offers travelers clean rooms and reliable accommodations. From the bed to the bath, the rooms are tiny. Really tiny. But the hotel is well located near a fine selection of pubs and restaurants. The wireless is reliable. The hotel bar serves good drinks and reasonable prices. The breakfast buffet is generous with good hours. Besides reliability, the another nice feature of Motel One Berlin Mitte is the hotel's proximity to the Moritzplatz subway station, which provides easy access to much of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely welcome to Berlin”
Reviews.Author: TiffTiph
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for one night (it was booked out for the rest of our trip), it was our first time to Berlin and I actually didn't mean to book this location but another Motel One location...though I am glad we stayed here. The other hotel gave us great directions to get here, the staff at this location were soooo lovely, helpful and chatty. We were put in a room with a double bed when we had booked a twin, so they happily changed us to a twin room that was much better too. The floor we moved to was being renovated so I think the rooms will be a lot better when that's all done, as the first room wasn't as nice as the one we ended up with. Free wifi in the lobby, but if you pay 7.50euro for breakfast they give you wifi in your room for 24hrs (without breakfast wifi in the room is 5euro). The breakfast was delicious!!! I loved it as it had lots of fresh and light food, my friend loved it as it had lots of pastries and cereal, we were both very happy. The staff at breakfast were so friendly too and teaching us German words which was very fun :) I would definitely recommend this hotel, and it's right next to an underground stop so very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Meiguoren1
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Motel One Berlin Mitte during January 8-12 was with a university study abroad group from the USA. This hotel is for the budget traveler who desires a convenient location that is close to the subway (public transportation) at Moritzplatz. The rooms are tiny, and the Wifi only works in certain sections of the building. However, the continental breakfast was fresh and satisfactory. The lobby is clean and has plenty of seating, and the bar is open all night. This hotel is good for the culture seeker that doesn't require many amenities and spends the majority of his/her time site-seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel but ideal base for Kreuzberg”
Reviews.Author: misstee83
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i stayed here for four nights. We wanted to fully explore Berlin, and in particular Kreuzberg. We found this hotel to be the perfect location for what we wanted. Located at the top of Oranienstrasse, with it's many bars, restaurants and laid back vibe, (think along the lines of Camden in London, or any of the more bohemian areas of major cities) we could also walk to the River Spree and see the remainder of the Berlin Wall/EastSide gallery, the 02 World arena and we also visited the Berghain club in this area. Aside from this location, Moritzplatz U-bahn is literally outside the door so everywhere was more or less easily accessible and so visiting the major tourist sites and areas was not a problem. The hotel itself was basic, but clean and comfortable. my only gripe would be when we went to check in at 1pm, we were told it was a 3pm check in and the left luggage room was full, so we had to leave out luggage in the reception area, unsecured. I would stay here again but would probably email the hotel before arrival to request an earlier check in - none of our booking confirmation documents specified the check in time. I would recommend this hotel if you are looking to explore Kreuzberg, a very cool, pretty (almost Parisian in parts) and reasonably priced area, with a definite edgy feel. If you are looking for a base in a more traditional tourist area it's probably not for you, but I would definitely stay here again and am already planning my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Better value for money elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: beesknees369
Reviews.Content: The snazzy lobby makes a nice initial impression, once you've gotten over the entrance from the street which feels like the Middle-of-Nowhere, Berlin. But it's downhill from here. The 'double' room is cramped and my child and I are falling over each other and our bags whenever we try to move around. The air conditioning only works if the outside temperature is over 21 degrees but hey, at least the window opens. Though I heard a guy at the front desk complaining because his window didn't even open. Poor man. Biggest complaint is the misleading 'free internet' - only free in the lobby. Heads up that you must pay 5 euros per day to get it in your room. Their system is further complicated by vouchers and login information that must be renewed daily, even for the free lobby Internet. All this added to the fact that the hotel is located on an unusually barren strip of Printzenstrasse, with no interesting shops, restaurants or cafes nearby, yet close to the entrance to the U-bahn Moritzplatz. I think you can definitely find better value for money - and better location - elsewhere. I would not book here again. Though the rooms are clean, I'll give them that.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, but thin walls”
Reviews.Author: Bavavia
Reviews.Content: My first night here was fine because no one was above me, but the second night was not so nice. The person above me was snoring and it kept me up most of the night, it was terrible. The breakfast was nice in the morning, but got crowded as the morning went on, but i was able to find a table. The hotel is in a good location not far from S Bahn. I was able to walk to a lot of locations including German resistance museum, i walked to the topography of terror exhibit, checkpoint charlie. It was a little bit of a walk, but i enjoyed the walk, you can also take the metro. There is free internet in the lobby. The hotel was nice and clean and new and good up until the point where the guest above me snored loudly and kept me up all night.

Reviews.Title: “nice budget motel with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: gregjw
Reviews.Content: ecellent location, right on the former border between East and West Berlin (Heinrich Heine Strasse checkpoint), only 3 subway stops (approx. 5 minutes) away from Alexanderplatz and three bus stops from Checkpoint Charlie and one S-Bahn stop to Potsdammer Platz; very friendly and helpful staff, free luggage storage; quiet and safe at night; downsides: aircondition wasn't working properly, WiFi only free in the lobby, unless you pay for the overpriced breakfast (EUR 7,5 , approx. USD 11); there are lots of nice and budget bakeries within 3 minute walking distance where you can get all sorts of breakfast for under EUR 4,-

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and Annoying”
Reviews.Author: arpita831
Reviews.Content: I went to berlin for the bread & butter fair and chose this hotel becasue the organizers recommended it. After paying 100euros for the room per night, the least i was expecting is a comfortable stay. However, the room was tiny and the AC was not working on all 3days. Even after repeated compaints nothing was done about it. The breakfast was very basic and the place was not even close to the fair. All in all a very annoying and disappointing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OmiDhaka
Reviews.Content: Its a Basic hotel. Room are fine with good bed. Breakfast is in the reciption area and not many choice. Next to the Metro station so you can move anyware you want.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget accomodation”
Reviews.Author: kellycrazie
Reviews.Content: Clean, friendly staff, quiet at night, no problem at all! :D It's not so much in the center of the city, but it's really close to the underground (in German "U-Bahn") and bus stop, so you can get to Alexanderplatz in no time! ;) Before we came there, I read some review somewhere and it said the Motel is hard to find. The truth is we saw it immediately when we arrived at Moritzplatz (by bus, if you use U-Bahn, it might depend on which exit you use I guess, so don't get scared if you don't see it at first sight ;)

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and good transport links”
Reviews.Author: nice_tie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights on a holiday to Berlin. Although the hotel is not that close to Mitte (more Kreuzberg) it is situated right next to Moritzplatz tube on the U8 line. We never waited more than 3 minutes for a train to take us all over the city. There was also a taxi rank and bus stop directly opposite the hotel so for sightseers transport links are great. The hotel itself is clean and comfortable. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I could best compare this to hotel to a more trendy Travelodge. Prefect for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: saudoso
Reviews.Content: This is a comfortable budget motel that doesn't make you feel like you're staying in a budget motel. It's simple but spotless, with nice design touches and an airy feel. 5 minute walk from dozens of cafe's and bars in Kreuzberg's Oranienstrasse street. Also a short walk down Marianenstrasse street to the canal front where there are a bunch of great restaurants. Berlin is rather spread out, so chances are you'll use the subway at some point. Being right on the moritzplatz U-bhan is a great asset for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good trendy budget hotel + perfect location !”
Reviews.Author: JulienF
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights at Motel One Berlin Mitte and I highly recommend this place, very good quality/price, if I return to Berlin, I stay there again. *Very good location about 20sec from Moritzplatz U-Bahn (U8) + this hotel is located in Kreuzberg neighborhood, you have cafés, bakeries, bars, restaurants, supermarkets and pharmacies about 2/5mins walk from the hotel. You are 3 stations away from Alexanderplatz. You have the M29 bus passing next to the hotel on Oranienstraße. You have a taxi stand next to the hotel as well. *Don't forget your soap/shampoo !!!! Very important, they don't provide. If you forget, you have a pharmacy 2 mins walk on Oranienstraße. *Good european breakfast buffet in the morning at the restaurant downstairs (croissants, bread, expresso, yogurt,....) *I booked with wifi into my room, good connection. *Staff was kind & nice with me. Very satisfied with this place !

Reviews.Title: “Spotless, friendly, great deal!”
Reviews.Author: Coxiella
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Motel One Berlin Mitte for 3 nights. The motel is 150 m away from metro station Moritzplatz which is very convenient. The staff at the front desk is friendly and helpful. Nice lobby with free wlan, comfortable seating areas and quite a variety of drinks and cocktails to reasonable prices. Rooms are spacious, spotlessly clean with great room service. Check out is at 12 am! Every room has air condition and flat screen tv with remote control. Breakfast was good: nice coffee machine with cappuccino, latte macchiato etc., ham, cheese, boiled eggs, fresh fruit, yoghurt, rolles, jam. Free newspaper. A great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Motel One - THE model budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: stockmos
Reviews.Content: If you wanted a template for a modern budget hotel, this would be it. Modern "funky" style, spotless throughout, functional and pleasant rooms, helpful staff, good breakfast buffet, free wi-fi in a pleasant bar. Do note that the rooms are simply furnished and there is only limited space to hang/store clothes. The hotel is about 150 metres from Moritzplatz U-bahn station, with very short trips into town. The area is good for eating places and cool bars.

Reviews.Title: “Modern design and comfort”
Reviews.Author: kaydoll
Reviews.Content: Motel One is located right next to the Moritzplatz U-Bahn station. There is also a taxi rank across the street. The reception staff are pleasant and professional. To access the room you get a code, which does away with keys and swipe cards. The rooms are compact and feature modern design. Each room has temperature control, remote control flat screen television, hair dryer, and toiletries. The beds are super comfy and I had such a good sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth staying”
Reviews.Author: joestep
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had stayed in Motel One in Nuremberg in 2008 so we thought we'd try Motel One in Berlin. There are a number of Motel One hotels in Berlin, this one was slightly cheaper that the one right in the centre. This chain of hotels is quite basic, but very comfortable. The hotel, like its counterpart in Nuremberg, was modern and clean. We stayed there for 3 nights. We stayed in room 301, which looked out over the main road. The bathroom was modern, clean with excellent water pressure and unlimited hot water. It was a little strange that the basin was located outside of the bathroom, next to the bed, but no real problem. The staff were very helpful and spoke excellent English. We were entitled to free wireless in the downstairs lounge / dining area. Breakfast was an extra 7.50 per person per morning - we only had breakfast the one morning, but it is excellent value - includes coffee, tea, juice, yoghurt, bread rolls, ham, cheese, cereals, fruit, boiled egg, etc. The room was quiet, although we didn't have the windows open. The air conditioning worked well and wasn't too noisy. Moritzplatz U-bahn, on line U8, station is directly outside. It is a few stops to Alexanderplatz U/S-bahn stations, but it is a bit of a pain to get to the West side of the city e.g. Potsdammerplatz, need to change lines a 2 or 3 times.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: ZsaZsa
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights on March 6th and 7th. The hotel lobby is very nice and modern. Check in was simple - they did require payment up front. The room was small but completely functional. It included shampoo and a hairdryer, but like others said, NO SOAP. Not a problem, shampoo is a soap too. The lobby bar is open 24 hours so we enjoyed a few drinks one night. Service to the table was hit or miss, but the bartender also covered as the check in desk clerk. We just went up to the bar and got our own. Casual and relaxed atmosphere. We never did try the breakfast, but it seemed busy each morning. We were impressed with the value for the Euro here. For a clean, modern hotel, it was a good bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - but Bring Your Own Soap!”
Reviews.Author: Anna_von_M
Reviews.Content: Motel One Mitte is a chain hotel which looks like it has been refurbished quite recently. The rooms are on a smaller side but they are perfectly functional with everything you may need in them (apart from the telephone, alarm clock and the soap!). I didn't mind the absense of a telephone at all but it would have been nice to have an electronic clock with an alarm installed somewhere. However, you may borrow the alarm clock at the reception should you need one for an early morning. Please remember that you may not borrow a soap bar from the reception! I must admit I was puzzled by the absense of a soap bar in the room but was told that since Motel One is a 2-star hotel, they do not provide soap but supply you with a complimentary shampoo only. It wasn't a big deal for me as I just went out and bough a lovely organic soap from a farmers shop just down the road. In terms of the room, it was lovely. Very quiet, clean, comfortable, well lit and cleverly laid out. The bed had a very good quality bedsheets and the towels were new and crisp. The rooms are cleaned and towels get changed on a daily basis at about 10 a.m. The shower is powerful and there were no problems with hot water at any time of day/night. The bar is open round the clock and you can get basic food, tea, coffee and alcohol whenever you want. I didn't try the breakfast but saw many people enjoying their coffee and morning snacks in the lobby. The reception staff are nice and friendly. Some of the staff speak better English than the other but I did not have a problem communicating. It is easy to get anywhere in Berlin from the hotel's location as U-Bahn Moritzplaz is 50 yards away from the main entrance. To get to Schoenefeld Airport, you have to take U-Bahn to Alexanderplatz, then walk across the square to get to the big overground station where you can get S9 overground train which will get you into the airport in 35 minutes. Very convenient at the price of 2.80 euros. Overall, I was very happy with my stay: clean and comfortable hotel at the current rate is always a pleasure to find. Would recommend it to a best friend without any doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Mynksteri
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel in August 2007. The hotel is very clean, as good as new. Double rooms are big enough. Toilets and showers are good. The hotel is located on a busy street, but the windows are soundproof and the rooms are quiet. Breakfast (6,5€ per person) is good, even if there may be too much people eating causing queues. The sights of Berlin are not nearby, but from the hotel there are good U-Bahn connections everywhere. The sights of Berlin are split in several locations and you have to use U-Bahn no matter where you stay. Lots of places to eat in the nearby Kreuzberg area, about 500m from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value!!”
Reviews.Author: emmabulloch
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be excellent value for money, the rooms could do with abit of improvement but are very clean and comfortable enough! The lovely reception/bar area, excellent location and friendly helpful staff more than made up for anything the rooms lacked!

Reviews.Title: “very basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jimsreview
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through website and got a good rate. Free parking is not in a parking lot but on the street. Beds have very thin mattress on platform. Room very small. No phone in room. When we asked how to operate the air conditioner in the very warm room, we where told that the outside temperature was below 20 degrees celsius so the air conditioners would not work. Opened window which cooled room but also let in traffic noise. Hotel close to U-Bahn trains. Ok hotel if you just need the room for sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but very clean”
Reviews.Author: jrleeper
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four (two adults and two children) and stayed at this motel. As you're driving to it, you think it's in a bad part of town. After checking around, it's just an old part of town that used to be in or close to the part of Eastern Germany. Parking is very secure and is 9,50 euros per night. Breakfast is nothing to brag at 5,00 euros but it does get something in your stomach before you start the day. When you walk into the lobby, it's very modern compared to the outside. The rooms are small but impressively clean (that's always my main concern). We had a connecting room to our kids. The bar is small but serves it's purpose. It's close to the U-bahn even though we didn't use it. As soon as we got to the hotel, we dropped off our bags in the room and walked everywhere. The next day we took the Fat Tire Bike Tour and and saw most of the main sights to see of Berlin in just a matter of 4-5 hours (and it's in English). I highly recommend this tour. For the price of this hotel, we couldn't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Basic but clean”
Reviews.Author: johnnybaby
Reviews.Content: If you want a cheap and clean place for a night or two this might be the one for you. Not in a very attractive part of the city. Rooms consist of one double with a single above bunk bed style (that's why you can't see the rooms on the web). Rooms are very clean but small and stuffy - ask for a non smoking room 'coz ours stank. All of the furniture is plastic (they really don't want you to hang about). Breakfast was fine. Right beside the U-Bahn (Maritzplatz). If you are used to any form of comfort this is not the hotel for you.

HotelInfo.Name: Motel One Berlin Mitte
HotelInfo.Address: Printzenstrasse 40, 10969 Berlin, Germany
